1    Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

     The City of Florence Water Department as operators of the Cypress Creek Water Treatment Plant are
     committed to employee, public and enviornmental saftey. This commitment is demostrated by our accidental
     prevention program that covers such areas as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance and
     training. It is our policy to inplement apporpriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.
     It is also our policy to provide training for all our employees that handle any regulated substance. If a release
     occurs we are coordinated with the City of Florence Fire Department and the Florence Lauderdale EMA which
     provides emergency personnel and equipment to control and mitigate the effects of a release.

2   The Facility and The Regulated Substance Handled

     The Cypress Creek Water Treatment Plant primary activities is to provide potable water to the City of Florence
     and Lauderdale County and to meet or exceed all Federal and State regulations. We have one regulated
     substance at this facility. This substance is Chlorine. The Chlorine used at this facility is used for the disinfecting
     treated water for potable use by the City of Florence and Lauderdale County.

     The maximum inventory at this facility is 12,000 pounds.

3    The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical - Specific Prevention Steps

      This facility has taken all the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requriments set 
      out under 40 CFR part 68 of the EPA. The following sections brefily describe the elements of the release 
      prevention program that is in place at our facility.

      Process Saftey Information

      The Cypress Creek Water Treatment Plant maintains saftey information that describes the hazards of Chlorine,
      operating parameters and procedures and equipment designs associated

with the chlorinating process.

      Process Hazard Review

      This facility conducts reviews regularly of the chlorination system to ensure that hazards assoiciated with our
      process are identified and controled. The reviews are done by the plant superintendent, lead maintenance and
      operator personnel.

      Training

      This facility has a training program in place to ensure that all personnel are trained in the hazards and safe
      handleing of chlorine. This program requries each employee that handles chlorine to take refresher training
      every three years. All of our employees are grade IV certified operators in the State of Alabama.

      Maintenance

      This facility's maintenance personnel peform maintenance checks on all process equipment to ensure proper
      operations. The equipment checked includes storage tanks, pipeing and valve systems,relief and vent systems
      emergency shut down systems and controls. If any deficiencies are found they are corrected in a safe and
      timely manner. All maintenance personnel are offered specialized as needed.

      Employee Participation

      All employees at this facility are encouraged to express therir views on accidental release prevention and to 
      recommend improvements.

4    The Five Year Accident History

      This facility has an excllent record of preventing any accidental release over the last 5 years. There has been 
      no release from this facility during this period.

5    The Emergency Program

      This facility has coordinated with the City of Florence Fire Department and the Florence Lauderdale EMA to
      respond with emergency personnel and equipment as needed in any accidental release. All facility personnel
      required to update their training every three years and specialized training is done as needed. We have not done
      any drills up to this point. This facility has a public notification in place to notify the public in the event of a

accidental release.

6    Planned Changes to Improve Saftey

     There are some changes this facility needs to make to improve saftey. Plans are currently being made to have a
     drill with the City of Florence Fire Department and Florence Lauderdale EMA on our emergency response.We at
     the City of Florence Water Department are committed to saftey and are always seeking to improve saftey.
